info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 6 at 8:58PM EDT until July 9 at 12:30PM EDT by NWS Raleigh NC
info.description:
...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in North Carolina...
Haw River Near Bynum affecting Chatham County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Haw River near Bynum.
* WHEN...From this evening to early Wednesday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, flooding begins, the river widens up to 400 feet across. It floods pastureland on the right bank and woodlands on the left. At 15.0 feet, Moderate flooding begins. The river widens up to 800 feet across, but flooding remains confined to extensive stretches of woods and pastureland along the river. At 17.0 feet, Major flooding begins. Several homes along the right bank of the river are flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:46 PM EDT Sunday the stage was 13.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.3 feet around 8 am Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.4 feet on 02/07/2020.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers.
The next statement will be issued byMonday morning.
